About Me

Phd student at the Univerity of Cambridge studying NLP

I am a first year PhD student at the University of Cambridge Computer Laboratory supervised by Professor Ted Briscoe. My PhD research focuses on text simplification, the study of how we can automatically adapt text to suit the needs of different audiences.

I am a member of Jesus College and a recipient of the Harding Distinguished Postgraduate scholarship.

Contact

You can reach me via the contact form. Alternatively, my email is shg36[at]cam.ac.uk, other social accounts are linked in the menu.

Latest News

  • Awarded Cambridge Language Sciences Incubator Fund to investigate how eye movement relates to text complexity.
  • Two papers accepted at LREC 2020: (1) Detecting Multiword Expression Type Helps Lexical Complexity Assessment (2) SeCoDa: Sense Complexity Dataset
  • Paper accepted for the READI workshop, to be held at LREC 2020: Incorporating Multiword Expressions in Phrase Complexity
